snippet: The writer Huan Hsu recounts his efforts to recover his ancestors’ lost treasure in a new memoir, “The Porcelain Thief: Searching the Middle Kingdom for Buried China.”
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Huan Hsu memoir The Porcelain Thief: Searching the Middle Kingdom for Buried China recalls his efforts to find family heirlooms supposedly buried in Chinese village in World War II; Theriault’s auction house will sell memorabilia from personal collection of Shirley Temple; Maryland Historical Society in Baltimore hosts exhibition A Tale of Three Coffins: Living and Dying in 17th Century St Mary’s City.
lead_paragraph: The writer Huan Hsu recounts his efforts to recover his ancestors’ lost treasure in a new memoir, “The Porcelain Thief: Searching the Middle Kingdom for Buried China.”

headline.main: ‘The Porcelain Thief’ Chronicles a Trip to Unearth Chinese Heirlooms
